data.title: Pretty good food, unpredictable service
data.text: I had dinner and breakfast here. Evening service was attentive, pleasant, good. Morning service was poor to say the least, I was mostly ignored, didn't feel welcome at all. Place was nearly empty, two staff acting as hostess/waitress combined, both grumpy. Business travelers are usually not interested in lounging around, fast service should be simple enough, ordering near immediate (not 10 mins between seating and first word), coffee refill should be automatic (I was not even asked if I wanted some). Anyway, easy to jmprove, especially given the food has on both occasions quite good, good draft beer and some wine selection in the evening, etc. Place has potential, but not without consistently good service.

data.title: Terrible
data.text: Jumped in for a quick diner just the other night. Lace almost empty, took the waitress 10min to serve me, calamari where by far the worst ever, wine was warm. Only good thing was the entrecôte, well prepared and the fact half of the drinks where not on the bill. Will never go here again.

data.title: New menu, better service, good value.
data.text: The menu has been completely redone since our last visit.  I ordered the fish of the day which was perfectly grilled salmon with a generous portion of broccolini smothered in a garlic oil and a side of parmesan fries.  The others had burgers and quesedillas.  Everyone enjoyed their entrees.  They run a hockey night happy hour that saves a few bucks on the drinks.  The service was friendly, prompt and professional.  Alva will likely remain our go to spot before hockey games (Until Duke's southern kitchen reopens!)

data.title: Great Burger but
data.text: We arrived and checked in to the Indigo Hotel and chose to eat at the Alva the in-house bar/restaurant. Once seated we selected the cheddar steak burgers and fries and a couple of glasses of red wine (cab). The burger the best I have had in a long time, the wine ok at a happy hour price (5 to 7pm). Our server completely disappeared during our meal and we had to "come up with a price" to charge to our room. (And come up with a tip amount on a price none of the staff could verify was correct for what we'd ordered.) Not really how it should be done. Food excellent shame the service was completely random at the end.

data.title: Nice and convenient resto bar
data.text:
We stayed at the Indigo last weekend. Drove from Montreal for a 24-hour and did not feel like going around looking for a place to eat. You can access the restaurant from the hotel lobby. Nice decor. Varied menu and nice choice of beer. We share a flatbread topped with meat and a chipotle chicken pannini served with French fries. Both were tasty. Our waitress was very friendly.
Upon our return from the stadium we decided to stop by the restaurant for just a quick bite. Well that quick bite turn out to be a delicious plate of shrimp and spinach pasta. To die for! Same waitress, same smile!

Next morning stopped by for breakfast before heading back. Oops... not same chef I guess... I ordered eggs Benedict with hollandaise sauce. 😖 The poached eggs were over done and the hollandaise sauce was just melted butter poured on top. Yuk! My husband had crispy french toast. Ok but did not look like maple syrup.
Maybe not the place for fancy breakfast.

All in all good experience but not recommended for breakfast.

data.title: Great spot for a meal before hockey game or arena event
data.text: We went back to Alva for a quick bite prior to a game and were very pleased with the service (fast, courteous an professional).  Our waitress (I should have noted her name) brought us a complementary plate of seasoned roasted peppers.  The happy hour pricing on the wine was quite reasonable and the food was very good.  The past Bolognese was excellent, creamy, flavorful and meaty.  The wings were delicious as well.  The burger is exceptional.

data.title: Good bar prior to concert
data.text:
Arrived a little early for the concert so had a walk around a couple of streets in Newark. 
Whilst looking for a place to sit in, stumbled across the Alva. So glad we did.
Had a great bar tender in Eddie who took very good care of us. 
Happy hour from 4-7pm was also excellent value.

data.title: Greatest Party Ever!!!!!
data.text:
I had a small get together for my birthday. It was the Best birthday celebration I have ever had. The Food was DELICIOUS!!! My guests kept raving about the shrimp and grits. The service was impeccable thanks to Bill Gibson and Corey! I would highly recommend this venue to anyone who desires stylish ambiance, great food and excellent service!
 THANKS A MILLION BILL!

data.title: Pure Delight
data.text: Once again, I went to the Indigo Hotel for dinner. The wait staff was very friendly, my meal was delicious and the overall ambience of the hotel was relaxing. (you must try the pork chops)  After dinner, I decided to go upstairs to the Skylab on the rooftop to check out Karaoke night.  The views from upstairs are amazing, the people were friendly and I had a marvelous time.  Believe me, I am coming back soon!

data.title: Great Service & Excellent Food!!
data.text: The server was prompt and courteous. Aesthetically appealing, affordable prices and excellent food.  A warm atmosphere, great service and a delicious meal!!

data.title: Great Steak & Drinks!
data.text: Stopped in for a nice dinner with co-workers to discuss our business trip. Alva had a great selection of craft beers and cocktails that we all enjoyed. The steak was cooked perfectly and was delicious. Nice place in the middle of downtown Newark!

data.title: Pre-show dinner at Alva
data.text:
We had a 5:45 reservation for dinner prior to a 7:30 show at the Prudential Center. When we arrived, we were greeted warmly and seated at a comfortable, but dimly lit banquette near the vault. Our server, Brianne, arrived promptly to introduce herself and take our drink order. Our cocktails were delivered in short order. She was most personable and entertained us with the history of the restaurant and its' name. The location had once been Thomas Alva Edison's laboratory, hence the name, and a bank in its' next reincarnation. This explained the huge vault, barred gate and other artifacts that decorated the space.

Our orders were taken and there was a bit of a wait for the appetizer, a kale Caesar salad, which we split. The salad would have been more successful if baby kale had been used and grilled before presentation. The dressing was served on the side, which was appreciated.

Our entrees were delivered in a timely manner and our drinks replenished. My Steak Frites was prepared perfectly! A generous cut of NY Strip that was beautifully seasoned, tender and delicious. The Frites were hot and crisp However the grilled asparagus was almost cold. Briannne asked how we were enjoying our meal and immediately replaced the asparagus with a plate that was freshly grilled. My husbands meal was equally delightful. Brianne attended to our every need without being intrusive, even as the restaurant became filled to near capacity. 

Dessert was a decadent cheesecake with dark cherry sauce that was generous enough for two!  Our dinner was excellent and we were allowed to linger at our table even as the venue became near to capacity. I would advise anyone who plans to dine here before a show to make their reservation on the earlier side.

owner_response.author: William G, Manager at Alva Tavern, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your response!  We are taking steps to become a leading restaurant in the Newark area.  Your comments will help us.   - we look forward to seeing you again soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Needs New Management
data.text:
We had 6:00 reservations for dinner allowing for plenty of time to catch our 8pm show at the Prudential Center. After sitting for 20 minutes, had to get up from our table to find a server for menus. 10 minutes later they arrived. We told our server that we had an 8pm show. Our server was charming but hard to find throughout our stay. At 7:45 (an hour and 45 minutes later) our food still hadn't arrived and our show was beginning in 15 minutes. Had to get up again to find our server as she was MIA. Asked for a manager but never got one so we paid for our drinks and left. The strange thing was that when we left, the restaurant was empty so there was no excuse for not bringing our food other than poor planning on management's part.

A note to the owner. The restaurant seems that it may have potential but for the sake of your business, please replace the management.

owner_response.author: William G, Manager at Alva Tavern, responded to this review
owner_response.text: I do apologize for the type of service that you received on Saturday evening.  I had a full team there in anticipation for your arrival, and the arrival of the other reservations that we did get.  Unfortunately, many guest did not make any reservations.  From 6:15pm until 8:00pm, the restaurant was packed to capacity with everyone needing fast service to "catch the show".  We did what was possible to get service and food to our guests, but because of the timing and volume to guests that we had, this became impossible.  I am looking at different ways that we can service our guests during shows and concerts.  Nevertheless, we did fall short of your expectations.  I would like to invite you back to my restaurant so that you can experience our normal type of service.  Please contact me at 973-718-9533 so that we can make arrangements.  Thank you so much!!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good food & service in an old bank near Prudential Center
data.text: We have been looking for a good restaurant near Prudential Center to go to prior to NJ Devils games.  Dinosaur BBQ is excellent but crowded and one  must wait up to 45 minutes for a table.  Venue is cool in appearance but the food was not good. (I'll try it again in hopes they have improved with experience.)  Alva is just next door to the arena and the combination of great, gracious service and very good food has made it our favorite.  The Lobster roll, soups, salmon and all of the entrees we have tried have been very good.  The burger and garlic fries are especially good.

data.title: Great burger and good value.
data.text:
Ate here before a NJ Devil game recently and it was very good.  It is literally next to The Rock so very convenient for any event there.  We started with the cajun shrimp and grits appetizer.  This was excellent, not too spicy and they were served on what I would call a grit pancake.   Excellent but it was pricey considering there were only 3 shrimp and the grit cakes were half dollar size.  

I had the Pat LaFrieda burger and my wife had the chicken sandwich.  Both were very good - large portions of meat and chicken.  The homemade garlic and herb fries served with both were excellent.  A large portion and they were fresh cut, not frozen.  $14 may seem expensive for each but they were well worth it.  When you consider that inside the Rock you'd pay $10 for a precooked, frozen burger with cardboard fries it is a good value. 

The restaurant and bar was not crowded at all which was enjoyable.  Most of the other local spots are usually packed and extremely noisy.   Not so here.  They offer several different draft beers and they were also good.   Our waitress Blanca was very helpful and was always checking on us to ensure we had what we needed.  

If you are going to a Devil game or any other event at the Rock I would highly recommend Alva.

owner_response.author: William G, Manager at Alva Tavern, responded to this review
owner_response.text: I am happy that you enjoyed your meal and experience with us at Alva Tavern.  We have made major steps in enhancing our service.  I will definitely share with Blanca your feedback.  Please come back and visit us again soon.  We are having a great New Year's package planned.  Please call us at 973-718-9533 if you are going to be in the local area.

data.title: Eatery in the new Hotel Indigo in downtown Newark
data.text: It's great to see a new hotel with a new restaurant in downtown Newark.  A benefit to people visiting for business, working in one of the many offices nearby, or in town to see an event at NJPAC or "The Rock"  Our meal at Alva was pleasant enough but hopefully it will get even better as time goes along.  It has promise and the ambiance is nice with a unique style in it's old bank building location.  Looking forward to trying it again on another occasion.

data.title: Great place
data.text: Dined here whilst staying at the Hotel Indigo. The service was great, food great, drinks were great. Cool atmosphere, used to be a bank, and the huge safe door is still there, they're going to turn the old vault into a pizza oven later this year. Alva is named after Thomas Alva Edison, this was his first chemical lab prior to becoming a bank. Great lighting, exceptional vibe.
